column4: I am a strong believer in the principles of both judicial independence & due process for accused persons in all cases. I have recently read reports about the Uribe case that raise serious questions about whether due process has been followed in the investigation and in his arrest https://t.co/ghXqoLwnMb

This is the wrong move, especially at a time when we are beginning to see Covid cases falling and social distancing/mask wearing working. It is critical for people to be tested if they have come in contact with a Covid positive person. https://t.co/5jgPziMf1M
Remote voting effectuates social distancing and follows proper health procedures. The work of Congress must continue, but it need not put people at risk unnecessarily. (3/3)

Votes have been occurring remotely for several months now, with no adverse consequences. Given the recent COVID-19 positive test results for my colleagues, including Louie Gohmert today, this method of voting is the prudent and rational course of action. (2/3)

I’m deeply concerned the Ortega regime in #Nicaragua continues to cover up impact of COVID-19 within its borders. I urge full cooperation w/medical experts to mitigate the devastating effects of this virus & support the well-being of the Nicaraguan people https://t.co/GUPO91YAQF

Cong. should utilize all options for conducting business. Proxy/remote voting allows for distancing/following of proper health procedures. We have important work to do over the coming months & it cannot be delayed; however, it isn’t necessary to put people at risk in the process

The House was right to pass H.Res. 967, to allow for proxy and remote voting on a temporary basis to ensure the safety of its members, staff, & support personnel that work within the Capitol Hill complex. We are still in the midst of a serious, global pandemic. (1/2)

Congress should get back to work on behalf of the American people when it can be done safely and securely. Right now, remote or paired voting is the best, safest alternative, until the pandemic subsides and normal voting procedures can occur. https://t.co/QMDmLMlZvL

Typical-Maduro regime places 1 of its most corrupt & criminal officials in a critical leadership role as the economy collapses further amid the ongoing health crisis. The postal service must adapt to changing markets. In 2019 the USPS lost over $8 billion dollars, so COVID-19 is not the underlying problem for them. The USPS should adjust pricing, eliminate o.t., adjust delivery schedules & eliminate subsidies to compete https://t.co/nNDafbGTd1
